name: AsystMe
tag_list: proactive-automated-assistant, automated-assistant, predictive-automated-assistant, smart-mobile-services, context-aware, context, mobile, cloud, task-automation
overview:
AsystMe’s proactive intelligent assistant keeps mobile users better informed with less effort.

People cannot continuously search, so our assistant automatically does it for them; we deliver “the right notifications” of news, suggestions, or offers to the user via their mobile device. We deliver the right information from the right sources at the right time; we do this with the right response options and with the right privacy for each user.

Some notifications carry lightweight, mass-appeal information such as sports scores, commodity prices, or traffic alerts; other notifications may appeal to niches or provide links to more expansive content. The user may want an early wake-up call if the weather is bad, traffic alerts before and during their commute, sports team news (not just scores) in the evening, and offers for discount tee-times if their schedule is open. In all cases, the user is in control; our assistant filters and notifies based on the user’s real-time context (activity, location, busyness, etc.) and his or her context-specific configuration.

Configuration is simple, with single-click subscriptions to topical news or offers. We provide some topics; others will be “crowdsourced.” User-created topics can be shared with friends or made publicly available. Topics can be used out of the box, or the user can personalize “the what” and “the when.”
